item.title: Intro to Advanced Joystick Configs - Part 1
item.description: The Problem with Windows Using multiple joysticks on Windows can be a huge pain. There is no guarantee of the input device order when your machine reboots or when they’re plugged, even if you follow the same order every time. This is compounded for Star Citizen where you’re asked to remove the USER folder each time there is an update, and the configuration interface has a long way to go before it’s not a pain to use.

item.title: Intro to Advanced Joystick Configs - Part 2
item.description: Note: This is part 2 of a series. If you haven’t already installed all the required tools, go check out part 1 first. Open JoystickGremlin, load profile and ensure correct devices are set Ensure JoystickGremlin is active (green controller icon) and check Monitor vJoy that input is affecting the vjoy controller Delete USER folder Launch StarCitizen Copy Actions.xml to USER/Control/Mappings (restart?) Options -> Keybindings -> Advanced -> Load Defaults -> HOSASAT
